page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY:CHEVENING
page.content: Chevening Estate originated in the late C12th on the site of a small village & church. Owned by the Lennards in the Tudor period and by the Stanhopes for 250 years until 1967 By will of the 7th Earl of Stanhope and by Act of Parliament, this large, Queen Anne residence is administered by a Trust & may be occupied by a member of royalty directly descended from George VI or a Cabinet Minister. Nominated persons to occupy this {historic house}have been: Rt.Hon. Anthony Barber 1973 Rt.Hon. Lord Hailsham 1973-4 H.R.H. {Prince of Wales} 1974-80 Rt.Hon. Lord Carrington 1980-2 Rt.Hon. Francis Pym 1982-3 Rt.Hon.{Sir Geoffrey Howe} 1982- From 1980 Chevening has been the official country residence of the { {Foreign Secretary}
